awards.description: This prize is awarded for the most innovative master thesis of the year. It was awarded for my master thesis on the Implementation Aspects of Lattice-based Key Management in large-scale distributed IoT networks.

projects.title: Research at Nokia-Bell labs: TCP Prague evaluation
projects.description: During this second research project, we evaluated the two main implementation of the TCP Prague congestion control algorithm. Moreover, once this evaluation finished, we improved their behaviours in order to make them act closer to the Prague requirements.

contributors.headline: Research, Training & Education Lead at Sue B.V.

projects.title: Research at Deloitte: Ansible plugin for PLC configuration
projects.description: Over the course of our first research project, we implemented an Ansible plugin to automate the configuration of OpenPLC devices. Moreover, we looked at a Schneider M241 PLC and a Velocio Ace PLC to reproduce this. However, due to vendor lock and a lack of open source protocols build in these devices, it has not been possible to achieve this.

contributors.headline: Research, Training & Education Lead at Sue B.V.
Cybersecurity Specialist

projects.title: Master Thesis: Lattice-based cryptography
projects.description:
Over the course of five months, I wrote my master thesis on the implementation aspects of lattice-based key management in large-scale distributed industrial IoT networks. For this, I created a new lattice-based Key Encapsulation Mechanism (KEM) for resource-constrained devices that enables the distribution of a symmetric key or any other data between all the nodes in a given network. This has been achieved by coupling multiple private keys to a unique public key. Moreover, a proof-of-concept, written in C, based on the GGH algorithm was implemented.
The results from this implementation prove it is feasible to use lattice-based cryptography to allow for a seamless and secure communication within a decentralised IoT network.

contributors.headline: Research, Training & Education Lead at Sue B.V.

projects.title: Easytips
projects.description: We worked on maintaining and refreshing easytips.be. This is a site for sharing notes and summaries between students of the Polytechnic Faculty of Mons. As the code was recently purchased, we ensured its integration into our IT system. In addition, we decided to thoroughly modernise the site in order to refresh its interface and change the back-end technologies used to more recent and efficient languages.

projects.title: Aero Layer Generator Optimizer (ALGO)
projects.description:
Clients : Cenaero et Sonaca
During this project we created a python software to perform 3D modelling of carbon fibre aircraft parts. These parts are composed of multiple layers of carbon fibre placed in different directions. Depending on the directions of the layers, the parts are able to resist to given mechanical constraints. Therefore, given certain constraints, we solve the associated complex combinatorial problem of layer overlays to create a configuration that will respect the constraints.

projects.title: Facial Recognition on Embarked System
projects.description: We studied the feasibility of facial recognition on a portable device (Raspberry Pi, Jetson Xavier) using Python and Facenet. Due to the low performance of the Raspberry, we weren't able to implement a usable version of the recognition software. But we succeeded on the Jetson Xavier.

profile_positions.description: Following my year on the board, I decided to take a step back knowing that traveling to Sweden for five month would complicate the regular board meetings. Therefore, I started working on maintaining and refreshing one of the company's internal websites, easytips.be. This is a site for sharing notes and summaries between students of the Polytechnic Faculty of Mons. As the code was recently purchased, we had to ensure its integration into our IT system. In addition, we decided to thoroughly modernise the site in order to refresh its interface and change the back-end technologies used to more recent and efficient languages.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description: As treasurer of YEP'tech, a non-profit organisation, I was in charge of the financial transactions and their long-term follow-up. In addition to this, administrative formalities such as submitting the annual accounts to the federal finance department were my responsibility. At the annual general meeting, a presentation of the accounts was made to ensure full transparency to the members.
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description: During a two-month internship at Multitel, I completed the installation of the open-source IDS Suricata on their internal network. This work ranged from the analysis of various IDS on the market to the delivery of the finished product. This internship required the implementation of a syslog server and a dashboard, based on the Elasticsearch suite, to monitor traffic. In addition, a portable probe was set up to monitor traffic at specific locations on the network. To test the effectiveness of the system, pentesting was performed.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description: This was the opportunity to get an insight into the inner workings of Alstom, a multinational company specialising in the rail transport sector, by following one of their engineers in his work. We were able to discuss the various electronic measures that are in place on the European and global railways to ensure the safety of passengers and the smooth running of trains.
profile_positions.title: Companion student

profile_positions.description: As assistant to the teachers who were preparing the future medical students for their entrance exams, my role was to prepare the exercises and support the students when they solved them themselves. The subjects taught covered analysis, algebra, statistics, trigonometry and vector calculus.
profile_positions.title: Teacher Assistant
